Posts.Title: So confused and heartbroken, stage lV? M-Aug M-Aug

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2011 11:41AM eulabt wrote: Hello Mommyrnx2, I am so sorry that you have to go through all of this, but I think you are totally doing the right thing. I was diagnosed at 40 and am now 41. I am just 4 1/2 months from diagnosis. I had a BMX with Tissue Expanders. I am having my exchange surgery next week. I am stage 1, no chemo or radiation and on tamoxifen for 5 years. My children are 8,10 and 12. It has been hard on them, but they are doing well. I am strong as well, but have my moments.  As far as the surgery, I would get as organized as you can. Take anyone up on any offers of help. I had friends cooking dinner for me for a month and that really helped. My husband was home for 2 weeks, which was great as well. I was able to get back to doing most things to some degree at 2 weeks.  Good luck, Eula

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2012 06:16AM eulabt wrote: I took me quite a while. I had my tissue expanders in for 3 months. Once those were exchanged for the implants, I felt so much better. Give yourself some time. You have been through so much. I am almost a year out from ym BMX and I still don't feel like I used to. I feel good,but different. Good luck.

Posts.Title: How to decide to have the "other" breast removed. TB90 Stenokim

Posts.Content: May 7, 2012 06:00PM eulabt wrote: I hope you don't mind that I chime in here. I did have reconstruction at the age of 41. I was small to begin with and I will say that I don't love my new boobs. I liked my old ones, but I was flat. The expanders were pure hell for me and my DH was ready to demand that they be taken out. I stayed small because I wanted to be me. I never wanted to look any different. My husband and I have a very good sex life, but I will say I really don't like him to touch the foobs, because they are fake and they remind me of what cancer took from me. I am so thankful to be alive today and happy to move on. My husband loves me for me. I do think it is sad to be happy that someone got better boobs out of having BC. I really respect not having reconstrction as my mother did not. My father was so in love with her until the day that he died. She was 59 when she was diagnosed and that was a large part of her not wanting reconstrction.   I guess what I am trying to say is that it isn't any better to have reconstruction verses not. We have all been through so much and if you are in a truly meaningful relationship, your partner will not care about your chest.
Posts.Title: What does your husband/loved one think about your flatness? otter otter
